Observation Tower

+25% combat experience and a free promotion for all recon units trained in this city.[NEWLINE]Strategic Resource Stockpiles increased +10 (on Standard Speed).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]May not be built in an Encampment district that already has a Stable or Barracks.
+25% Earned experience from Observation Tower
New World Explorers
Recon Units gain +1 Movement and +8 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength.
As the world becomes bigger and more dangerous, those who explore it must be capable of living up to the task.
Governments can choose to support these expeditions, allowing explorers to be better prepared, both in exploration and combat.
+12 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength from New World Explorers
Diplomatic Immunity
Recon Units can enter foreign lands.
Sometimes you need someone on the inside. Most civilizations will not allow your armies to pass through their borders.
This means it is up to small and (probably) harmless teams to negotiate entrance.
Can enter foreign lands without open borders.
Public Trade Security
Recon Units can enter foreign lands. Land Trade Routes within 3 tiles of a Recon unit cannot be plundered.
In a world controlled by trade and markets, merchants are both the backbone of civilization and a tasty prize for bandits wishing for bounty.
Guards assinged to protect these trade routes are granted passage through most lands; everybody understands their importance!
Protects nearby land Trade units from Plunder.
Trade units near a your Recon Units are immune to being Plundered on Land Tiles.
Landmark Re-purposing

Forts and Shelters provide 2 [ICON_Gold] Gold and 1 [ICON_Culture] Culture with Charming appeal and 5 [ICON_Gold] Gold and 3 [ICON_Culture] Culture with Breathtaking appeal. After Flight, they provide [ICON_Tourism] equals to their culture output.

Abandoned buildlings once used for war and exploration do not need to be torn down in times of peace and tranquility. Instead, they can repurposed in new ways. Old forts can become expensive hotels with an exciting history, abandoned shelters can provide relief for hikers visiting nearby parks.
Whatever designers, architects and visionaries come up with, these buildings are sure to become great atraction for people of all places.
Occupying an improvement that provides defense gives this unit an additional +1 Sight and + 5 Strength when defending.
+4 [ICON_STRENGTH] from occupying defensive improvement.
+4 [ICON_STRENGTH] from fortified recon unit.
Shelter
Provides half the defense and fortification bonuses of a Fort. +1 Appeal to surrounding tiles.
